title: Delicious Japanese food in a modern setting
text:
Authentic delicious Japanese food set within The Hari hotel. Try and book a booth as they as cosy and comfortable. Highly recommend the wasabi prawns, soft shell crab rolls and the chicken katsu curry.

For dessert definitely try the Mochi cake with coconut ice cream.

The staff were very friendly and hospitable. Cost will be around 1500hkd pp with a couple of drinks.

title: Beef brisket a must (avoid the short rib)
text:
No where else in HK does a better beef brisket, it melts in your mouth! The steak tartar and the cauliflower were delicious too. Avoid the short rib (600 hkd), it is small and very fatty.

The cookie soft serve is addictive. Definitely book before going as this restaurant is very popular.

title: Mohinga a must try
text:
The is Mohinga (classic Burmese rice noodle soup) is a must try. Would also recommend the egg curry bites to start and the beef biryani for mains.

The Laphet Thoke (traditional Burmese salad) was disappointing as it lacked the authentic flavour.

Try and book a booth, especially if you are a bigger group.

title: Pricey for not a lot
text: The food was good but not somewhere you would go rushing back to. I am a big fan of black sheep restaurants and this was a bit of a let down. The ambiance was lacking. Highly recommend the wagyu beef.

title: Small portions
text: The service was very good but the food portions were very small. There is outdoor seating which is very pleasant. The food was ok but was not anything special.

title: Tasty Turkish food
text: They do a great set lunch (£13) mon -fri. Highly recommend the tabouleh and the hummus to start and the lamb skewers (a bit fatty) for mains.

title: Delicious Mediterranean cuisine
text:
A great selection of fresh Mediterranean dishes. Highly recommend the hummus, tabouleh and the grill prawns to start. The mixed grill platter for mains is a must. The falafel was also very good.

I would advice families to sit upstairs as it’s quieter. Downstairs has a DJ and belly dancing and is quite lively.

title: Delicious food, incredible view
text:
This is a must try when in Athens. Try and book a table just before sunset so you get to fully appreciate the view/sunset across Athens.

Highly recommend the fresh Greek crab with turmeric and also the grouper. The chocolate mousse with biscuit was also very good.

The service here is excellent, they were very attentive and helpful.

title: Japanese/Greek fusion
text:
Having lived in Asia for 6 years, this was definitely a new experience for me as I had not had a Greek/Jap fusion before.

I highly recommend the zucchini with smoked eggplant and also the sirloin with spring onion.

The service here is impeccable. Would definitely book before going. They were fully booked 3 days in advance when I tried to book.

title: Arabic/Italian food
text:
A large choice of Arabic and Italian dishes. Highly recommend the Kibbe (goat meat) and the Turkish pizzas. The tabouleh and the pizza lacked flavour.

They also have a decent selection of fresh juices. Try and get a seat upstairs on rooftop as you get a great view.

title: Excellent all round
text:
This hotel is set in a great/safe location, with incredible views from the rooftop. The staff are very hospitable and helpful, and the rooms are modern, spacious and clean.

Breakfast is served on the rooftop so you get phenomenal views of the city and the Acropolis. Highly recommend going to the rooftop for sundowners.

The gym is small but has enough equipment. The pool is only about 12m in length.

Would definitely stay here again.

title: Get there for 8am
text:
Entrance is open from 8am. I highly recommend getting there then as it is a lot cooler and a lot less busier. Wear comfortable (ideally sports shoes) footwear as the ground is very rocky and take water. The exhibition takes about 90-120 mins to complete.

Buy the package ticket for €30 as this allows you to see 6 other sites across the city. If this is the only site you want to see then the cost is only €20.

title: Great view from rooftop
text:
Definitely book in advance and try and get a table on the rooftop as it has a great view of the Acropolis.

Highly recommend the tuna tataki for starters and the salmon with ponzu sauce. The pork with mashed sweet potato was also good. I tried the dumplings but found them very sweet (almost like a doughnut).

title: Solid Greek food
text: Set right in the tourist district, next to the museum, this restaurant is a good spot for lunch. Highly recommend the lentil salad and also the courgette stuffed with rice and meat.

title: Stunning!!
text:
A stunning luxury hotel that I will definitely be coming back to and would highly recommend. The view across the ocean is second to none, the staff are very hospitable and the rooms/facilities are modern and clean. They provide a full variety of choices for breakfast. The pool is very clean and well maintained.

It is located within walking distance to a clean, clear sandy beach which also has a beach club (Punda).

It is only a 25 minute drive from the airport and a 20 minute drive from Naousa. I would hire a car for the duration of your stay.

I will definitely be going back.

title: Fresh home cooked seafood
text:
Hidden gem tucked well away. I read a few reviews before going, I thought the service was excellent. Highly recommend the fava with octopus and also the grilled squid. These 2 dishes are a must try.

Will definitely be going back.

title: Beautiful garden setting
text: Set on the backstreets, this restaurant is set within a beautiful garden. Highly recommend the oven cooked chickpea and also the fig with cheese. The Moussaka was a bit disappointing as it lacked flavour.

title: Traditional Home cooked food
text: Great spot for lunch, with a view out to the ocean. Recommend the beetroot salad and the spicy meat balls. We also had the lamb but found it a bit dry.

title: Fresh seafood on the pier
text: Set right on the edge of the pier, this restaurant has a great ambience. I highly recommend the prawn in spicy sauce to start followed by the prawn risotto. We also had the tuna steak, which was ok, but the risotto definitely stood out.

title: Incredible view
text: Set on the road side, this unassuming restaurant has beautiful views across the hills. Highly recommend the baked chickpea casserole to start and the Greek salad. The goat (not on the menu) was very good but a bit oily.

title: Incredible!
text:
Every dish was delicious. Highly recommend the mixed mushrooms with buffalo to start. They currently have a special of stuffed cabbage and chard leaves which was delicious. For mains I recommend the beef short rib, which literally falls off the bone.

This is one of my favourite restaurants in Paros. It’s very popular and I would book ahead of time.

title: Hole on the wall
text: A tucked away little hole in the wall. Recommend the aubergine salad and the chicken stick platter (big enough for 2 people to share). The platter comes with chips and fresh homegrown tomatoes and onions, as well home made bread. This is a great spot for a casual lunch.

title: Fresh fish along the pier
text:
Set within a beautiful location right along the pier (next to the boats) this family restaurant has a delicious selection of dishes. Highly recommend the ceviche, avocado and tuna tartar and the grilled John Dory.

I highly recommend booking in advance as this restaurant is very popular amongst the locals and tourists.

Our waiter Monolo (son of the owner) was very hospitable and helpful. Would definitely go back here.

title: Brisket!
text:
Went here for lunch, for which they have a smaller menu compared to dinner. Highly recommend the brisket sandwich. The burger was also delicious too but the brisket was definitely the stand out.

If you like cheesecake try their strawberry cheesecake...u will not be disappointed.

title: I would go back here just
text:
I would go back here just for the starters. Highly recommend the short ribs, samosas, cauliflower and the paneer. They are presented/cooked and presented with a slight twist to usual Indian cuisine. The bone marrow stuffed naan compliments these well.

Unfortunately the mains were a big letdown. The biryani was very bland (even though it was presented well) and the vindaloo was more like some meat in tomato sauce.

The ambience was great, if it is not too humid try and get a table outside.

title: Authentic Italian
text:
Small quaint but modern Italian restaurant with a small, but delicious, menu. Highly recommend the fried mozzarella salad the beef stracinati and the Seabass.

They don’t sell wine but they allow you to bring your own with no corkage. Give the size of the restaurant and how popular it is I would recommend booking in advance.

title: Delicious Indonesian cuisine
text:
Indonesian restaurant with mainly Balinese dishes. Very chic Indonesian decor. Highly recommend the beef short rib, scallops and the Nasi Goreng. They also have a full bar with a variety of cocktails.

Would definitely go back here. Service was exceptional too.

title: Chicken tacos!!
text: Delicious fresh chicken tacos, that comes with a variety of hot sauces. Generally I am not a fan of corn but the grilled corn is a must try. They also have a decent bar/selection of drinks.

title: Awesome experience
text:
A great experience in which you feel fully immersed in. Great to try as a couple or with up to 6 friends. We tried Davy Jones, but they have 4 other games (which we will definitely go back to try).

The staff are very helpful and are there to support/supervise you throughout the game. Aiden in particular was very helpful, he even sent us video footage of us after.

title: Amazing cheesecake but also great mains
text:
This was the first Cheesecake Factory I had been to and I was very impressed. Recommend trying the salmon with kale salad and the Thai lime chicken.

Make sure you save space for dessert as the cheesecakes are large. Highly recommend the Oreo cheesecake or the crunchy hazelnut cheesecake.h

title: So good we went twice
text:
Fresh authentic Italian dishes that you will struggle to find outside of Italy. Highly recommend getting the chefs tasting menu especially if you are in a big group. Favourite dishes were the eel donuts, spicy crab pasta and the pannacotta.

Definitely book before going as it’s very popular.

title: Healthy breakfast
text:
A great selection of healthy breakfast choice. Highly recommend the topped toast, free range eggs with bacon and the green smoothie.

They also have a number of gf and vegan wraps/quiches.

title: Stunning views with good food
text:
This restaurant has stunning views over the trees and onto the ocean. Would suggest sitting outside and highly recommended the gnocchi and the pork hock.

Alongside being a vineyard they also produce their own gin (gin tasting worth a try).

title: A must try!
text:
This was definitely the best meal we had in Margaret river. Not only was the food and wine excellent but the service was top notch as well. You overlook their vineyards whilst eating.

Highly recommend the seafood platter, hummus and the pea terrine.

title: Seafood with an Asian twist
text: Highly recommend the Korean sashimi to start followed by the Indonesian crab. Note it’s with the shell so prepared to get your hand dirty. The fish wrapped in banana leaf was also very good. Would recommend booking in advance as it can get very busy.

title: Beautiful setting
text: Highly recommend the chicken pizza and the wasabi salmon. They also do a great fish and chips. Service is great and as a result they are very busy. They have a great selection of brews that you can try whilst you wait.

title: Good food, very poor service
text:
Not only did it take 15 minutes for someone to serve us, but they acted like they were doing us a favour.

Once we got the food (40 minutes after ordering) it was very good. Highly recommend the tiger prawns and the burrata.

Try and get a table outside to soak in the beautiful views.

title: Definitely try the salmon
text: This is a restaurant attached to Hilton Hotel. The food was surprisingly very good. Highly recommend the spicy chicken wings to start and followed by the wasabi salmon. The main courses come with unlimited trips to the salad bar.

title: Chic and trendy
text:
A modern minimalist hotel that is a stones throw away from Kings Park (which is worth visiting). There is no gym but the hotel has a deal with Next Generation gym which is a 10 minute walk away. Costs $20 when you show them your room key.

The only fault with this hotel is that the rooms are very small and can only just about fit a queens size bed in them.

title: Beautiful setting
text:
Set within the old Colonial house, this restaurant has similar cuisine as it’s sister restaurant ‘the Gallery’. Highly recommend the baked crab and the barracuda. The chicken tikka was slightly in the dry side.

This is also part of a boutique hotel.

title: Great city hotel, but not sound proof
text:
A modern, clean city hotel with comfortable spacious rooms. It’s set on the water front with great views of the ocean BUT be aware the rooms are not sound proof and you will be woken up by the train early in the morning.

Breakfast is excellent with a large choice of Sri Lankan and Western dishes. Nishani at the front desk was very hospitable and helpful.

There is a small underground mall attached to the building should you need to do any last minute shopping.

title: Favourite restaurant in Colombo
text:
This hidden gem was definitely worth visiting. It’s tucked away off the main road and the decor/ambience is very warm and unique for Colombo.

I highly recommend the lemon grass chicken and the black pork curry. The service was excellent and they have a vast selection of delicious desserts.

I will definitely be going back.

title: Highly recommended
text:
The service and attention to detail is excellent. You get a huge selection of freshly made Sri Lankan dishes for breakfast. They also have a large selection of western dishes. I would recommend getting half board as the dinner buffet is very extensive and changes every night.

We stayed in a deluxe room which has pool and ocean views. It also allows for VIP check in and check out. It also includes complimentary afternoon tea and complimentary happy hour drinks.

Mike and his staff were very friendly and hospitable. I will definitely be going back.

title: Bland and overpriced
text:
I was surprised at how bland the food turned out especially having read other reviews. We ordered the devilled prawns and the grilled tuna. The food took 45 mins to arrive and the restaurant only had 3 occupied tables.

Careful as they don’t put the price of some of the seafood next to some of the items. We paid 2000 LKR for a handful our (devilled) prawns.
place: Hilda's Coffee Bar & Sea Food Restaurant

title: Excellent city hotel
text:
Highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a city hotel. Very modern and clean, with views across Colombo. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Infinity pool on the roof gets sun throughout the day. The gym is well equipped and has 3 treadmills.

The breakfast buffet has a mix of western and Sri Lankan dishes. They also have afternoon tea at the rooftop restaurant which was delicious.

title: Delicious French fine dining
text:
This is a great restaurant for a date or a meal with friends. It is French fine dining so the courses are small but very rich. Highly recommend their version of a Niçoise salad and the falafel. They have a great wine selection and a number or different cheeses to match.

Their set menu is great value. The waiters were very attentive but at times it felt a bit rushed.

title: Steak and unlimited shoestring fries
text:
French bread, Walnut salad followed by steak and shoe string fries. Very simple and effective. You only get one portion of salad and steak but unlimited Fries.

They have a very impressive dessert trolley. Highly recommend the Apple tart.

title: Exceeded expectations
text:
This was the first time I had visited any Disney park. There were barely any queues for the rides, longest we had to wait was 15 minutes. Space mountain definitely the best ride. Would highly recommend the Lion King show. Mickey Mouse show was also very good. They have a number of night parades but we didn’t get to see this as we went early.

The food selection in the park is not great and very expensive.

title: Small menu, but great food
text: With only 3 main dishes on the menu and 2 appetisers, it’s easy to choose what you want. I would highly recommend the chicken ramen.

title: Delicious hotpot with great ingredients
text:
One of the best places to get Cantonese style hot pot on Hong Kong island. The location is conveniently nestled in Wanchai, in a comfortable, spacious setting. They offer menus in Chinese and English, as well as bilingual waiters.

The food is fresh, with tons of options! Having been to many of the hot pot restaurants in HK, Megan’s kitchen offers the most creative choices and diversify of dishes, from multi colored cuttle fish balls, to cheese-filled meat balls and Peking duck dumplings.

Broth options are plentiful and flavorful. Service is very attentive.
A great restaurant choice for big groups and out of town guests to taste all of their creative Cantonese style hot pot dishes.

title: Way too short
text: The walk to the event takes longer than the event itself. It is serene with all the candles and the live music but I think it could have been much better had the live music gone on for longer than 15 minutes. For 17 JOD per person it is expensive for what your get, which is basically 20 mins of entertainment.

title: Use these hacks
text:
Given how busy and hectic this beautiful site is I would recommend doing the following:
-arrange a private tour guide the day before (50 JOD for 2 hours)
-start your tour at 6.30am when the gates open. This way you avoid the crowds and get great pics.
-take a packed breakfast, water and snacks
-once you have finished the tour with the guide hike to old monastery
-you can have lunch at the crowne restaurant (17 JOD for the buffet).
-then do hike to top of mountain that gives you highest/best view of treasury

You should finish around 4pm. It’s a long day but definitely worth it.

title: Incredible Roman ruins
text:
Beautiful well kept Roman ruins. There is a hippodrome, amphitheatre as well as a market place and a number of temples etc

I would recommend getting a guide when you are there. Expect to spend around 2.5-3 hours at this site.

title: Must do!
text:
Not only was the accommodation incredible but the food and hospitality from the staff were also great.

The rooms enabled us to get a great view of the stars at night and also watch the sunrise in the morning.

Highly recommend the free stargazing walk at night. They also give you a free photo shoot with the stars.

The food was delicious and they make fresh bread in the morning. All the staff were very friendly, particularly the manager - Fdoul.

Try and get a pod that is on the outer circle of the camp.

title: Hidden Gem
text:
This is definitely a hidden gem, the food and service here were excellent. I highly recommend the cauliflower, sweet potato fries, ribs and the octopus. The restaurant has a very chilled ambiance and there is also a small bar.

You can usually get a discount on the eatigo app. Even without the the app, it is still great value.

title: Excellent all round
text:
From the service, to the rooms to the facilities you can not fault this hotel. It’s a modern hotel with the standard ‘W’ feel. The staff are very helpful and friend, the rooms are clean and comfortable. Try and get a room on the higher floors in order to get a phenomenal view of Amman.

There is a great spa with free access to the jacuzzi and steam room. The pool is shut during winter. Breakfast was excellent with a large variety of local and western dishes.i would stay here again.

title: Very relaxing
text:
I would recommend asking for corner room on the higher floors with a view of the main hot spring and you will also got a view of the Dead Sea (weather permitting). This is a very relaxing hotel that is worth staying in for one night (ideally towards the end of your holiday).

There are 2 main hot springs. The first is free if you are staying at the hotel and is pretty hot. The weather was chilli so this worked out perfectly.
The second is at the spa and cost c.$50 usd person or you can get free access if you purchase a spa treatment. I would NOT recommend paying $50 usd to use this as it’s very similar to the free hotel pool one.

The staff at the hotel are very hospitable, particular mention to Samer who helped us settle in. The food is excellent and the rooms are very comfortable.

title: My fave restaurant in Jordan
text:
We discovered this restaurant after 12 days of travelling in Jordan. It’s a busy local restaurant with barely any tourists and a lot of locals.

You will soon realise why this hidden gem is so busy...the food is the best we had eaten in Jordan. I would highly recommend the lamb cooked in the clay pot and the fatteh chicken.

There is live music and the service is excellent. This is a must try.

title: Friendly staff and great food
text:
This hotel is very unique in relation to the other hotels we stayed in within Jordan. There is no electricity in the room aside from in the bathroom. Ie no air conditioning or heating. They use candles to provide light during the night which gives the place a very serene/peaceful vibe.

The food is excellent. It’s all vegetarian but they had some of the best food I had eaten in Jordan. The staff are very friendly and hospitable.

There are a number of activities which include cooking classes, hiking, mountain biking, star gazing etc

title: Very convenient
text:
A 2 minute walk to the main visitor centre/entrance to Petra means this hotel is very convenient if you are visiting. It has a free car park next to it too. The room are basic but comfortable and clean. Breakfast is decent with a mix of local and western dishes.

It’s a local family run hotel that’s is perfect if you are just visiting Petra for the day.

title: Great place for casual meal
text:
About a 20 minute walk from the entrance to Petra, this restaurant is a great spot for local Jordanian cuisine. I highly recommend the chicken tawook and the tabouleh.

They also make fresh pomegranate juice which is a must try.

title: A must do!!
text:
This is not a tourist hotspot at the moment but I would not be surprised if over the next few years it becomes one.

It is a 12 century castle that has been well preserved and has absolutely stunning views of 3 different valleys.

This venue has some great spots for photography.

title: Would definitely go back
text:
This hotel more than exceeded our expectations from the moment we got there. It has its own private beach with staff to guide you on how to get the most out of the natural properties (mud, salts etc) from the Dead Sea. In addition there are 4 large pools.

Try and get a room with an ocean view. The rooms are very spacious, modern and comfortable. Breakfast consists of a large variety of dishes including Arabic and western dishes.

The staff are all very friendly and helpful. A big thank you to Aldalo, Ivan and Fares for their hospitality.

title: Excellent Mansaf
text:
The food here was so good we
Went back. I highly recommend the mansaf (meat with rice and a sauce). The tabouleh, hummus and baba ghanoush are excellent too.

It’s a family run restaurant and the staff/owners are very polite and attentive.

title: Great business hotel.
text:
Set right within the city this hotel is perfect if you are in Amman for business. The rooms are comfortable, clean and quiet. The gym is well equipped and in good condition. For breakfast there is a variety of local dishes (they make the bread fresh in a clay oven in front of you) and Traditional European dishes.

The staff were exceptionally hospitable and helpful. A big thank you to Mo’men (front office manger) who went out of his way to help us during our stay.

title: Highly recommended
text:
Set within an old Jordanian house in a bustling part of town, you soon realise why this restaurant is packed with locals and foreigners alike.

Highly recommend the Beitinjan fukharat (aubergine casserole) and the tabbouleh. I would book before going as this restaurant is very popular.

title: Authentic Lebanese
text:
The restaurant is a hidden gem. Would highly recommend the Kibbeh, beetroot salad and the vine leaves for appetisers. The mixed grill (particularly the chicken) was delicious.

The restaurant has ample parking and is great for book groups. Staff are very friendly and attentive.

title: Best to visit in the morning
text:
In order to get the best lighting I would recommend going in the morning. There are 2 museums which have interesting displays of the historic Bedouin garments and jewellery.

Entrance costs 2 JOD or you can use the Jordan pass.

Picture below is view from the citadel.

title: Great views across Amman
text:
Not only do you learn a lot about the history here you also get to see a 360 degree view across Amman. In addition you can get great aerial views of the amphitheater. There are guides (extra cost) at the front entrance of required. You should plan to spend between 90-120 minutes here.

This is a must do when visiting Amman

title: Delicious Mansaf
text:
A very local simple restaurant that serves delicious lamb mansaf (rice with lamb and hot yogurt sauce). This is a must try if you have not had this before. Some locals eat this by hand (recommended) or you can use cutlery.

They also serve very good tabouleh and mouttabal. For dessert they have a large selection of Jordanian sweets.

title: Incredible architecture
text:
This is a must do when in Abu Dhabi. It was the most beautiful mosque I had ever seen. Best times to go are either first thing in the morning or at dusk to avoid the heat and to get the best pictures. They have a 30 minute free walking tour which was very informative. The tours are on the hour every hour.

Would recommend wearing long clothing, but they do provide free clothing to cover up should you need it.

title: Fresh seafood
text:
You will struggle to get seafood much fresher than this in Abu Dhabi given the restaurant is situated right next to the fish market.

Would highly recommend the grilled prawns in spicy sauce, lobster tandoori and the prawn biryani. The Emirate curry sauce with the fish is a must try.

title: Delicious sushi
text:
Highly recommend the Omakase set lunch. This is only available for lunch (30 usd) Sunday- Thurs and consists of edamame cooked in wagyu fat, Toru, an assortment of sushi rolls and some mochi.

The restaurant is reasonably small so definitely book in advance.

title: Delicious French cuisine
text:
Definitely book before going as its a small restaurant. They do 2 sittings, 6pm and 8.30pm. The dishes are small and great for sharing. Highly recommend the hanger steak, vegetable casserole and the home made ice cream to finish. The food is not cheap, but in line with other similar restaurants in HK.

Nb. the restaurant is tucked away from the main street (Hollywood Road) so you may have to call them to find it.

title: Stunning views, great food
text:
Been here a few times and would highly recommend booking a table outside (weather permitting) to fully appreciate the view. Tried the new breakfast menu (finishes at 11am) for the first time and would highly recommend the masala omelette and the Keema with eggs.

if you are going for lunch/dinner would recommend the salmon and the railway mutton curry. Vidur was very hospitable and accommodating.

title: Great views across the harbor
text:
Great spot to have lunch or dinner on a nice day. It is slightly pricey but is very relaxed and tucked away from the busy streets of HK. You get a beautiful view not only of the harbor but also of the peak. If you are staying at the hotel you have access to the pool if you are not there is a charge to use the pool.

Would recommend the chicken quesadillas and the mix seafood salad.

title: Absolute bliss
text:
This conservation hotel is not only very picturesque but also has all the little details that made our stay very comfortable. Our room was stunning (and large) with a sea view. I was told all the rooms the same size but some had different views. Would highly recommend booking one with a sea view. All the rooms have a large bathroom with 2 sinks and a huge bath tub.

The hotel pool is set right on the beach front and you gets sun all through the day. There are plenty of beach chairs as well as hammocks and beds to relax on. Breakfast is excellent with a selection of western and eastern dishes.

Staff are very hospitable and accommodating. Ramesh (deputy manager) was particularly helpful and made our stay one we would never forget.

I would definitely go back here.

title: Comfortable and convenient
text: The hotel is located 15 minutes from the international airport. It is clean, modern and comfortable. I would try and book a room on the higher floors in order to get a better view. The rooftop pool is definitely worth a visit, even if just for a drink. The breakfast is excellent and caters to all needs with a eastern and western selection.

title: Ticks all the boxes
text:
This restaurant definitely ticks all the boxes - food, atmosphere, view, service. This was one of my favorite restaurants in Chiang Mai. Would highly recommend the crab fried rice, chicken curry roti rolls and the beef salad.

Expect to pay a lot more than the average restaurant in Chiang mai c.25USD per person I would book before going, especially for dinner.

title: Great facilities and location
text:
Only 20 minutes drive from the airport, this hotel is set within close proximity of the main centre. It has a 24 hour gym and a great pool. The extensive breakfast buffet is delicious and caters for all.

The rooms are modern and clean. Would recommend getting a room facing the hills/mountains.

title: Good food but very pricey (even for HK)
text:
The atmosphere was good, service amazing, and food was good, but for the price, I'm not sure it's worth a second visit. The tasting menu was over 1.1k HKD Plus 10% service charge. Highly recommend the cod with hazelnuts, french toast and the veal.

Would recommend booking as it is a small restaurant that is very busy.

title: Comfortable
text:
Comfortable hotel located a 20 min walk/5 min tuk tuk ride away from the town centre. The staff are very friendly and breakfast is great. Had dinner here one night and was not impressed as the food was dry and flavorless.

The pool is great for both adults and kids and they have a quaint out door bar.

title: Modern and sleek
text:
Set right on the ocean front this modern and sleek hotel is great for couples and families. There is a great pool facing the ocean. The rooms are modern and simple. Breakfast is a must with a small selection of western as well as local dishes.

The staff are very helpful. The hotel is a 5 minute tuk tuk ride away from the main town.

title: Flavourful and authentic
text:
This is definitely one of my favourite restaurants in Coron. The food is very flavourful (without being over powering). Highly recommend the seafood pasta, oxtail and the beef stew. They also have a great selection of European wines.

Will definitely be going back.

title: Baby back short ribs
text:
One of the best restaurants in coron. The beef ribs are a must try. Would also highly recommend the fish ceviche. You understand very quickly why this restaurant is so busy. Will definitely be going back.

I read all the reviews about bad service before going but was pleasantly surprised as the service was excellent.

title: Average Italian
text: The starters (mozzarella tomato and the salad) were pretty bland and whilst the mains were ok. The shrimp pasta was the best dish they had. Would not recommend the (canned) tuna pasta.

title: Stunning
text: A short walk from the boat up about 330 steps gets you to a beautiful picturesque lagoon. I went when it had been raining so the visibility in the water was not great. You only need about 90 minutes here maximum if you are snorkelling.

title: Chicken salad
text:
If you are looking for western cuisine this should hit the spot. Highly recommend the Cajun chicken salad that comes with fresh mangoes. They also do great sweet potato fries.

Also tried the tuna steak but this was dry as it was over cooked

title: Delicious tapas
text: I was pleasantly surprised at how good the Spanish tapas was. Highly recommend the meat balls, omelette, chicken in creamy sauce and the ginger fish. Each dish is about 250php which is pricey but well worth it. They also have a decent selection of wines.

title: Delicious Italian seafood
text:
Located in the recently refurbished Fleming hotel, this is a hidden gem. Highly recommend the tuna steak and the calamari. They also have a great selection of wines that accompany the food well.

The service was excellent. Very much appreciated the chef coming out to meet the diners. Would definitely book before going as it is very popular.

title: Best boutique hotel in Bangkok
text:
Located in the trendy neighbourhood of Thonglor, this quiet boutique hotel is hidden away. It has a great rooftop pool, huge bedrooms and an excellent breakfast. The service is excellent throughout the hotel. Apiwat in particular was very helpful in arranging my booking.

The hotel is in very close proximity (less than 10 minutes walk) to a number of restaurants and spas. I would definitely recommend staying here.

title: A must!
text:
Very unassuming from the outside this restaurant is a must try when in Bangkok. Every single dish was excellent. Would highly recommend the pork red curry (melts in your mouth), crab fried rice and the lamb massaman curry.

Understandably it gets very busy so would recommend booking in advance.

title: Very relaxing Onsen
text:
Set within a 5* star hotel is this modern and relaxed spa. We spent 4 hours here (2 hour Thai massage and 2 hours in the Onsen) and it cost 100 usd for the both of us. Highly recommend the package we got as the Thai massage was very relaxing and effective.

The Onsen is very clean and not very busy. There is also a hot stone room and a chill out room.

title: Izakaya + Jazz
text:
Ex Nobu chef has done a phenomenal job with this restaurant. Would highly recommend the Katsu sandwich, the pablo and Sichuan. Every dish was excellent, and in addition there is a live jazz band every night.

Definitely book this well in advance.

title: Clean and comfortable
text: Great location very close to the tourist sites of Paris. This hotel is clean and comfortable. The rooms are a bit small for my liking, but the service is excellent. They also have a gym and spa at their sister hotel next door that is available for free.

title: Delicious up market Vietnamese
text: Highly recommend this place if you are looking for a high end Vietnamese. It ticks all the boxes with the food, service and ambiance being on point. Definitely try the prawn toast, beef pho, king prawns and the Soft shell crab.

title: Delicious ceviche
text: If the weather is good try and get a table outside along the water. The outdoor tables are mostly shaded. Would highly recommend the sea bass ceviche and the lamb cutlets. The seafood is fresh and they have a great selection of cocktails. I imagine this restaurant would be busy at night and would recommend booking before going.

title: Average
text: Food was very underwhelming especially given the reviews I had read. Lacked a lot of flavour. The best dish we had was the lamb with parsnip chips. Service was excellent.

title: Very comfortable
text:
Situated very close to the city centre, this hotel is very comfortable and the service can not be faulted.
Try and get a room on the higher floors for a view across Belfast.
The buffet breakfast was very good, but the gym is very small. The hotel doesn’t have its own car park so you have to pay extra to park at a local car park.

title: Stunning surroundings
text:
The landscape here is stunning. Alongside the golf course there is the back drop of Enniskillen. Would recommend getting one of the cottages, which are very spacious. Breakfast was excellent at the Catalina restaurant.
Definitely take the time to go for a walk around the golf course, it takes about 90 minutes if you do the full course.
